techmeme.title: Discord requires some UK and Australian users to verify their age by scanning their face or ID to access sensitive material; Discord says it's "an experiment" (Chris Scullion/Video Games Chronicle)
A US judge grants a permanent injunction against an Ohio law that required platforms to verify users are at least 16 and seek parental consent for younger users (Bloomberg Law)
Google is making Gemini Live camera and screen sharing features free for all Android users in the coming weeks after launching them for Advanced users last week (Abner Li/9to5Google)
FTC challenges ex-Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg over past emails; she called Google+ a "real" competitor in 2011 and discussed blocking its ads on Facebook in 2012 (Bloomberg)
FTC v. Meta: Mark Zuckerberg says he considers TikTok the "highest competitive threat" for Facebook and Instagram in the past few years (Julia Shapero/The Hill)
